page.title: 06Retired People in Warton
page.content: 42.9% of adults are retired, most having a pension for main income. A flourishing Pensioner's Group founded for the 1953 coronation meets monthly. Many are taking advantage of grants to improve old property. Typical is an 83 yr old who has just had a new roof, insulation and central heating. A daughter of the builder of the 1902 school still treasures his old school books of 1872. She claims people retire here because it is a friendly place and feels there are no excesses of weather. Another claims that Warton is "God's little acre". One man recalls a population of 326 of whom he knew every one. He regrets the stopping of tolling the church bell to warn of a new death, 24 for a man and 12 for a woman. Though ended in 1917 the passing of this tradition is still a sore point with many.
